{"step_by_step_thinking": "The film thickness of luting cement is mentioned in several documents. Document [1] states that all materials produced film thicknesses under 30 microm at 3 minutes and under 26 microm at 2 minutes. Document [4] suggests that the cement with film thickness more than 30 μm should never be used for luting purposes. Document [6] mentions that nine materials satisfied the ADA type I specification for film thicknesses less than 25 microns. Document [15] states that all products revealed a film thickness of less than 25μm except for GC Fuji Plus. Document [25] states that the film thickness recorded in subgroup III (25.215 ± 0.661 μm) was the highest. All these documents suggest that the film thickness of luting cement is less than 30 μm.", "answer_choice": "A"}
